intro: Myosotis abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine or rocky habitats, preferring cool and moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the top of the stems. Myosotis abyssinica is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
